void FusionEngine::GenericEnvironment::send (   )  [protected]
 

Send all packets.

"Sending" can be done here (ofcourse, FusionNetwork will have done the real receiving, this just handles the data from it.)

void FusionEngine::GenericEnvironment::updateAllPositions (  unsigned int  split  )  [protected]
 

Updates the positions of all syncronised objects.

FusionPhysics methods should be called here. Provides predictive movement based on current velocity etc.

void FusionEngine::GenericEnvironment::updateShipStates (   )  [protected]
 

[depreciated] by installShipFrameFromMessage() Updates the state structures of local and remote ships.

Member Data Documentation

CL_Thread* FusionEngine::GenericEnvironment::m_NetManThread [protected]
 

Thread from which the network manager works.

Remarks:
Having the FusionNetworkClient object running in another thread removes the nessescity to limit it's working time per step (that is to say, it can take as long as it needs process every packet, as it won't hold up the redraw.) This may turn out to be more of a performance hit than just limiting it's working time, but it's easyer to remove code than write it in later :P

bool FusionEngine::GenericEnvironment::m_Quit [protected]
 

If this is set to true, the update command will return false next time it runs (thus quitting the gameplay.

)
